intro: Diapedium retortum, commonly known as the twisted diapedium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its spirally twisted stems and small, palmate leaves. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Diapedium retortum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
